snippet: One of the new perks in Apple's next version of iOS, the operating system for iPhones, is that people will be able to do FaceTime video calls over the cellular network. But a menu in an early version of the software suggests that AT&T is considering...
abstract: One of the new perks in Apple's next version of iOS, the operating system for iPhones, is that people will be able to do FaceTime video calls over the cellular network. But a menu in an early version of the software suggests that AT&T is considering charging a separate fee for the privilege.

headline.main: Will AT&T Charge for FaceTime on the iPhone?
